t: Legal issues with fan fiction - Wikipedia
s: February 13, 2025 - Current federal trademark law follows the Lanham Act, otherwise known as the Trademark Act of 1946. Under the Lanham Act, a trademark is "any word, term, name, symbol, or device, or any combination thereof" used in commerce to identify a service or good. Under this definition, it is possible for the names and likenesses of television, film and book characters, fictional ...

t: Amazon copied products and rigged search results to promote its own brands, documents show | Reuters
s: October 13, 2021 - Amazon.com Inc has been repeatedly accused of knocking off products it sells on its website and of exploiting its vast trove of internal data to promote its own merchandise at the expense of other sellers. The company has denied the accusations.
